alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; St. Francois (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 2:14PM CDT until July 28 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Jefferson and Washington. In southeast Missouri, Saint Francois. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Festus, De Soto, Pevely, Crystal City, Herculaneum, Hillsboro, Anthonies Mill, Olympian Village, Old Mines, Richwoods, Horine, Fletcher, Blackwell, Cadet, Victoria, Valles Mill, Latty, Hematite and Mapaville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
